decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall begin not later than three years from the date of this decision.

Reason: In order to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990, as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and specifications:  03-002-rev02 Received:  17 October 2024,  03-003-rev04 Received:  15 October 2024,  01-001, 01-002, 02-001, 02-002, 02-003, 03-001, 03-004 Received:  23 July 2024.  

Reason: In order to ensure the development is carried out in accordance with the planning permission.

Condition : 3 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the development hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building, unless otherwise shown on the approved plans.

Reason: In order to safeguard the appearance of the area.

Condition : 4 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification), no additional windows, doors or other glazed openings shall be formed in the single storey rear infill and rear extension hereby approved.  

Reasons:  To protect the appearance of the area and neighbour living conditions in accordance with Local Plan Policies SC7 (Residential extensions and alterations), CC1 (Context and character), CC2 (Urban design and architecture) and CC4 (Heritage) and the Residential Extension Guidelines.
description: Erection of a single storey rear and rear infill extension following demolition of the existing single storey rear conservatory to the house.
